Constructor Detail

TurnKeeper

public TurnKeeper(GUI gui)
Sets the game to turn 1, and creates a new ScoreKeeper. Also sets the newGame boolean to true so the player can change their image.

Parameters:
gui - takes a gui and connects it to the turnKeeper.
Method Detail

checkForLoser

public boolean checkForLoser()
Checks if there is a loser by checking if all square values are set to -2.

Returns:
boolean returns true if the game is over and false otherwise

checkNewGame

public boolean checkNewGame()
Checks if the newGame variable is true. returns boolean true if it is a new game, false if the first turn has been taken

getTurnValue

public int getTurnValue()
Gets the turn value.

Returns:
int returns the turn value.

newGame

public void newGame()
This method is called from the menubar. It resets the game. It first sets the newGame to true so player images can be changed. It then sets all squares to -2 and changes the images accordingly. Then it get a random number and sets the turn equal to that number.

passTurn

public void passTurn()
Passes the turn. This is run after the player clicks on a square. First it increases the turn, then mods it by two. If it is 1, it is player 1's turn next. If it is a 0, it is set to 2 and it is player 2's turn next. Then it changes the name on the turn panel if their isn't a winner. If there is a winner, it chacks for a loser.

takeTurn

public void takeTurn(int sqrNum)
This method is called when the player clicks on a square. The square passes its value through the paramater. The square score is then changed and the image is changed. The game is checked for a winner, and then the turn is passed.

Parameters:
sqrNum - the square number that was clicked on.
